bibl.note: This is a letter dated July 18, 1830 from Adam Fergusson in Carthage, Tennessee to Joshua M. Coffee in Alexandria, Tennessee. In the letter Fergusson informs Coffee of a rumor that the clerk of the County Court may resign his office, and that if this speculation is correct, he would like to be considered for the job.

div1.p:
I adress you upon a subject which seems to threaten to agitate the People of Smith County before long; In this I may be mistaken but if I am it will be the case of many others. It is whispered about and seem the opinion Seems to be gaining ground that our clerk of the County Court will resign his office, at the next year and two canidates are already in nomination. I would here remark that I think the idea is premature and as far as my enquiries go the present clerk will be Sustained in office at least the peace of Smith County would require it. I would further remark that I would no means insinuate any thing as respectful to the present Clerk on the contrary I would like to see him Sustained Remain as he is But should it prove otherwise and a new clerk is to be elected, you with the rest of your the fellow Justices will be called upon in your official capacity to make a Suitable choice to fill his place. In doing this Your Judgement will be exercised to make a Suitable choice Judge of the deliver on the qualifications of those who may be candidates. Among those who will offer their pretentions for that High and respectable office I hold myself as one. I have been in office I have had transactions with most of the people of this county and I feel no small pride in saying that they have on all ocations given me the most flattering
proofs of their confidence. My acquantance with you as I trust is of such a character as to enable you to weigh judge of my qualifications and give them that Suport which you may think them enabled to. I would here remark that I belong to no party and have kept myself aloof from all conections with the politicks of the day. and as I hope your are not one of those who will form your oppinion or provide your Suport until you know who all are candidates With regard to necessary qualities to make a clerk they consist of so many that room cannot be found here so enumerate them Sufice it to Say that I intend calling upon you when and wher we will talk of matters and things in general I would like to see you here on the evening of tuesday the 21 it being our regular meeting, and I know your friends generally would like to see you.

If in the course of your acquantance you should meet with an oppurtunity of conversing with some of the Justices of the peace upon the Subject (and I do think it necessary) you will be so kind as to mention me as a candidate. I understand the other candidates spoken of are Don C Dixon and David Greer but your own good prudence must tell y that there will be many more. I put
I wish yo to write to me on the receipt of this letter either by the first oppurtunity or by mail and would like to hear your views on the subject and also the opinions of your friends. as it is out of my power to leave home Give my respects to your friends and I hope you will pardon the trouble this may give you I wish you to consider this as a confidential consideration as it is not known how matters will turn out until time shall give evidence
div1.closer:
with Sincere respect I am yours &c A Fergusson Atttest
Jona Pickett
Jona Pickett
James Joshua M Coffee Esqr Alexandria Smith County TennesseeCopy
